Practising Digital Empathy

Fei Liu is a designer, artist, writer, and empath using storytelling and to create digital experiences that foster dialogue and human connections. Currently a contributing researcher at non-profit organization China Residencies, DJ and radio host on artist run radio station Bel-Air, and keypuncher at Public Science. Previously Researcher in Residence at DBRS Innovation Labs, and graduate of Parsons MFA Design and Technology.

CV | LinkedIn | SoundCloud | Twitter

new mercy park

Web-based narrative that is part alternate reality game, part poetry, and part software tutorial, resulting in an experience that spans months and takes place across chat boxes, emails, and other internet platforms.

Humans of Simulated New York

Completed at DBRS Innovation Labs, HOSNY is a participative agent-based simulation built to speculate alternative economies. It asks how world-building as interactive gameplay creates the opportunity for a better and more complete understanding of the complex relationships that make up the systems of our world.

Quantified Life

An embodied Dystopian experience that re-imagines the relationship between ourselves and our work, between the Quantified Self and the Quantified Other, and between quantification and qualification.

Quantified Life

An embodied Dystopian experience that re-imagines the relationship between ourselves and our work, between the Quantified Self and the Quantified Other, and between quantification and qualification.

Crystal Keyboard, CCPM

CCPM proposes an alternative way of looking at the way we use the devices we rely on the most. What if the the energy we expend and “waste” can be harvested and stored into a battery for later use? Could these typing-powered batteries then be treated as designed objects with their own narratives and sentimental purposes?

new mercy park

Web-based narrative that is part alternate reality game, part poetry, and part software tutorial, resulting in an experience that spans months and takes place across chat boxes, emails, and other internet platforms.

Humans of Simulated New York

Completed at DBRS Innovation Labs, HOSNY is a participative agent-based simulation built to speculate alternative economies. It asks how world-building as interactive gameplay creates the opportunity for a better and more complete understanding of the complex relationships that make up the systems of our world.

Quantified Life

An embodied Dystopian experience that re-imagines the relationship between ourselves and our work, between the Quantified Self and the Quantified Other, and between quantification and qualification.

Quantified Life

An embodied Dystopian experience that re-imagines the relationship between ourselves and our work, between the Quantified Self and the Quantified Other, and between quantification and qualification.

Crystal Keyboard, CCPM

CCPM proposes an alternative way of looking at the way we use the devices we rely on the most. What if the the energy we expend and “waste” can be harvested and stored into a battery for later use? Could these typing-powered batteries then be treated as designed objects with their own narratives and sentimental purposes?
